meanings.definition: One who dislikes or has an aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: The misliker of spicy food always opts for milder dishes.
meanings.sent2: She is a misliker of horror movies and prefers comedies instead.
meanings.sent3: The misliker of rainy days decided to stay indoors and watch movies.
meanings.sent4: Being a misliker of heights, she avoided the tall roller coaster.
meanings.sent5: The misliker of public speaking felt nervous before the presentation.

meanings.definition: To have a negative opinion or feeling towards something.
meanings.sent1: He tends to misliker vegetables but tries to eat them for his health.
meanings.sent2: She will misliker any form of injustice and always stands up for what is right.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to misliker the new brand of food and refused to eat it.
meanings.sent4: After the incident, he began to misliker crowded places due to the memories.
meanings.sent5: The student started to misliker math after struggling with a difficult concept.
